description:
The seventeenth century was a time of revolution and upheaval, of excesses both puritanical and cavalier. It saw the execution of one kind and the restoration of another, and surved the English Civil War and the great Fire and Great Plague of London. This course explores the literature of this century through the works of John Milton Milton's major works (selected sonnets, Comus, Areopagitica, Paradise Lost, Paradise Regained, and Samson Agonistes), and his contemporaries. We will concentrate on a number of issues that governed writing in the period, particularly the tension between individual interiority and historial, social and political activity. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of the current offerings.
name: MILTON
